Feb. 17, 1998

The Cook County Sheriff's Office hires Major Coleman III as a deputy sheriff.

Feb. 21, 1999

While working an off-duty security job at a Dominick's, Coleman fires two shots into the ground when a man who stole a can of baby formula punched him and ran away. Coleman is suspended for 10 days.

JAN. 31, 2006

Coleman resigns from the Cook County Sheriff's Office to become a full-time officer with the police department in South Holland.

May 29, 2006

South Holland fires Coleman for being late and sleeping on the job. Coleman claims in a lawsuit he was fired for racially discriminatory reasons. South Holland settles for $30,000 in January 2015. He joins the Dolton police department days later.

Jul. 28, 2007

Coleman and another Dolton officer shoot Rodney Chaney-Jackson, 25, who was armed with a gun, following a carjacking. One police bullet explodes a residential window down the street.

Jan. 1, 2009

Coleman shoots Fermon Booth, 24, in the lower back. Coleman says he shot Booth, who was unarmed, after he raised his right arm. Dolton agreed to pay $45,000 to settle Booth's lawsuit.

Dec. 4, 2009

Coleman shoots Jeremiah Lomax, 19, a suspect in an armed robbery, once through the left thigh. Coleman says he was shot at first.

Jul. 15, 2011

During a police chase reaching 100 mph, Coleman shoots out the tires of an SUV driven by Sharrieff Rowell, 29, who is unarmed. Police find nearly six pounds of marijuana in Rowell’s car but Dolton settles a lawsuit with him for $10,000.

Apr. 14, 2012

Coleman and a fellow officer shoot and kill Darnell Robinson, 22, during a shootout in the parking lot of a nightclub. Autopsy reports show Robinson was shot multiple times.

FALL 2015

Coleman is promoted to detective with the Dolton Police Department.
